bcl:section.bcl:text: In this regulation, Act means the School Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Who may hold office as regional trustee

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Except as provided in this Part, a person is qualified to be elected or appointed to and hold office as a regional trustee of a francophone education authority if, at the relevant time, the person meets all of the following requirements:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person must be an individual who is, or who will be at the time of voting or on the effective date of the appointment, as applicable, age 18 or older;
the person must be a Canadian citizen;
the person must have been a member of the francophone education authority for at least 80 days preceding the relevant time;

the person must not be disqualified by the Act or any other enactment from being elected or appointed to or holding office as a regional trustee of a francophone education authority, or be otherwise disqualified by law.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: At any one time, a person is not eligible to be elected as a regional trustee for more than one ward established under section 166.14 (8) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Without limiting section 2 (1) (d), the following persons are disqualified from being elected to or holding office as a regional trustee of a francophone education authority:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person who is disqualified under section 4 as an employee of a francophone education authority, except as authorized under that section;
a person who is disqualified under section 166.18 (6) [unexcused absence from board meetings] or 166.19 (3) [failure to make oath or affirmation of office] of the Act;
a person who is disqualified under the Local Elections Campaign Financing Act

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: from holding office on a local authority, or
as that Act applies under Division 4 [Campaign Financing] of Part 2 of this regulation;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person who is disqualified from holding office under Division 18 [Election Offences] of Part 3 [Electors and Elections] of the Local Government Act as it applies under that Act, the Act or any other Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Disqualification of employees from regional trusteeship

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, employee means an employee or salaried officer of a francophone education authority.

Unless the requirements of this section are met, an employee of a francophone education authority is disqualified from being elected to or holding office as a regional trustee of the same francophone education authority.

Before declaring an intention to stand for election as a regional trustee of a francophone education authority under section 7 (1) (a), the employee must give notice in writing to the employee's employer of that intention.
Once a notice is given under subsection (3), the employee is entitled to and must take a leave of absence from the employee's position with the employer for a period that, at a minimum,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: begins on the date on which the notice is given, and
ends, as applicable,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the person withdraws as a candidate in the election, on the day after the withdrawal,

if the person is declared elected, on the day the person resigns in accordance with subsection (7) or on the last day for taking office before the person is disqualified under the provisions referred to in section 3 (b),
if the person is not declared elected and no application for judicial recount is made, on the last day on which an application for judicial recount may be made, or
if the person is not declared elected and an application for judicial recount is made, on the date when the results of the election are determined by or following the judicial recount.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If agreed by the employer, as a matter of employment contract or otherwise, the leave of absence under this section may be for a period longer than the minimum required by subsection (4).
Sections 54 and 56 of the Employment Standards Act apply to a leave of absence under this section.
Before making the oath of office under section 166.19 of the Act, an employee on a leave of absence under this section who has been elected must resign from the person's position with the employer.

At the option of the employee, a resignation under subsection (7) may be conditional on the person's election not being declared invalid on an application under section 18 of this regulation or section 166.18 (4) of the Act.

In every year in which regional trustees of a francophone education authority are to be elected, the secrtaire trsorier of the authority must, at least 90 days before election day, provide notice to the members requesting that members who are prepared to stand for election as regional trustees declare their intention to do so.
The notice referred to in subsection (1) must be provided by publication in a newspaper.

At least 75 days before election day, a member of a francophone education authority who is prepared to stand for election as a regional trustee for a ward must provide to the secrtaire trsorier, in writing, the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a statement, signed by the member, in which the member declares an intention to stand for election as a regional trustee;
as applicable, a statement

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: that the member is acting as the member's own financial agent within the meaning of the Local Elections Campaign Financing Act, or
identifying the person who is appointed under the Local Elections Campaign Financing Act to act as financial agent for the member;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the written disclosure required by section 2 (1) [requirement to make written disclosure] of the Financial Disclosure Act;
the information required under subsection (2);
a solemn declaration of the member in accordance with subsection (3).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (1) (d), the following information must be provided:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the full name of the member;
the usual name of the member, if the full name of the member is different from the name the member usually uses and the member wishes to have the member's usual name on the ballot instead;
the francophone education authority in relation to which, and the ward in which, the member is prepared to stand for election as a regional trustee;
the residential address of the member, and the mailing address if this is different;
a telephone number at which the member may be contacted;
an email address at which the member may be contacted, unless the member does not have such an address;
an address for service within the meaning of the Local Elections Campaign Financing Act;
any other information or material required by regulation

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: under section 168 [election regulations] of the Local Government Act, or
under section 92 (1) (g) [provision of information between Elections BC and local authorities] of the Local Elections Campaign Financing Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (1) (e), the member who intends to stand for election must make a solemn declaration

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that the member is qualified under the Act to hold the office,
that, to the best of the member's knowledge and belief, the information provided under this section is true,
that the member fully intends to accept the office if elected, and
that the member

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is aware of the Local Elections Campaign Financing Act,
understands the requirements and restrictions that apply to the member under that Act, and
intends to fully comply with those requirements and restrictions.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A solemn declaration under subsection (1) (e) must be

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: made on oath or by solemn affirmation,
made before a commissioner for taking affidavits for British Columbia, and
signed by the member making the oath or solemn affirmation and by the commissioner before whom it is made.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Members who are already serving as regional trustees may declare an intention to stand for election under subsection (1) (a).

At least 70 days before election day, the secrtaire trsorier must provide to each member of the francophone education authority, by electronic means or by mail, a list of all members planning to stand for election as regional trustee.

If there is any change in the information or material required to be provided under subsection (1) (b) or (2) (e), (f), (g) or (h) (i), the member must, as soon as practicable, provide updated information and material

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to the secrtaire trsorier, if the change occurs before the declaration of the results of the election, or
to the BC chief electoral officer, if the change occurs after the declaration of those results.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The obligation under subsection (7) (b) to provide updated information and material to the BC chief electoral officer ends when all disclosure and record retention obligations under the Local Elections Campaign Financing Act in relation to the member have been fulfilled.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Challenge of member declaration to stand for election as regional trustee

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A declaration of a member to stand for election as a regional trustee may only be challenged by an application to the Provincial Court in accordance with this section.

The time period during which a challenge may be made is between the time the member provides the secrtaire trsorier with a written statement under section 7 (1) (a) and 4 p.m. on the 60th day before election day.
A challenge may be made only by a member who is resident in that ward and is entitled to vote in that ward, and may only be made on one or more of the following bases:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that the member is not qualified to stand for election as regional trustee;
that the declaration was not made in accordance with section 7;
that the usual name given under section 7 (2) (b) is not in fact the usual name of the person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The document filed with the court to commence a challenge must briefly set out the facts on which the challenge is based and must be supported by affidavit as to those facts.
At the time a challenge is commenced, a time must be set for the hearing that is adequate to allow the court to give its decision on the matter within the time limit set by subsection (7).
The person making a challenge must notify affected persons by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: immediately notifying the secrtaire trsorier and the person whose declaration is challenged that a challenge will be heard by the court at the time set under subsection (5), and
within 24 hours of filing the document commencing the application, serving on these persons that document, the accompanying affidavit and a notice of the time for the hearing.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Within 72 hours of the end of the period for commencing a challenge, the court must hear and determine the matter and must issue an order, as applicable,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: confirming the person as eligible to stand for election as a regional trustee or declaring that the person is no longer standing for election as a regional trustee, and
declaring that the person is or is not entitled to have the usual name referred to in section 7 (2) (b) used on the ballot.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The court may order that the costs of a challenge, within the meaning of the Supreme Court Civil Rules, be paid in accordance with the order of the court.
The decision of a court on a challenge under this section is final and may not be appealed.
The person making a challenge must notify the secrtaire trsorier within 72 hours of the decision of the court.
The secrtaire trsorier, on receiving notice under subsection (10), must reflect the court's decision in the voting materials provided under section 10 of this regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:text: If the number of candidates who have declared themselves willing to stand for election as regional trustees in a ward does not exceed the number of regional trustees to be elected in that ward, the secrtaire trsorier must, at least 30 days before election day,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: declare those candidates elected as regional trustees in that ward, and
provide to each member who is entitled to vote in that ward, by electronic means or by mail, a copy of the declaration.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the number of candidates for regional trustees exceeds the number of regional trustees to be elected in that ward, the secrtaire trsorier, at least 30 days before election day, must provide to each member who is entitled to vote in that ward the following in electronic or other form:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a ballot containing the names of all candidates for regional trustees in that ward and stating the number of regional trustees to be elected in that ward;
a voting declaration prescribed under section 21;
instructions for completing and submitting a ballot and a voting declaration.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The names of the candidates on the ballot referred to in subsection (1) (a) are to be set out in alphabetical order or, at the discretion of the board of regional trustees of the authority, the order of the names is to be determined by lot drawn by the secrtaire trsorier.
The accidental omission to provide the material referred to in subsection (1) to a member or the non-receipt of the material does not invalidate an election.
A member who is resident in a ward and is entitled to vote in an election for that ward may vote for any number of candidates up to the number of candidates to be elected in that ward.
Subject to section 12 (2), voting in an election may be by paper or electronic ballot.
A member must vote in accordance with the instructions referred to in section 10 (1) (c).
A member who has voted must, in accordance with the instructions, submit the ballot referred to in section 10 (1) (a) and complete, sign and submit the declaration referred to in section 10 (1) (b),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the member votes by paper ballot, at least 15 days before election day, or
if the member votes by electronic ballot, no later than 8 p.m. on election day.

bcl:section.bcl:text: If voting is delayed and the secrtaire trsorier considers that a significant number of members would not be able to vote without an extension under this section, the secrtaire trsorier may extend the time for the close of voting but the extension must not permit voting for a longer period of time than would have been permitted had voting not been delayed.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), the secrtaire trsorier or a person appointed by the secrtaire trsorier must supervise the collecting and counting of votes according to a procedure that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: rejects all but one of the ballots of a voter who submits more than one ballot,
rejects a ballot that is not submitted with a completed and signed declaration, and
prevents the identification of voters.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The secrtaire trsorier may direct that electronic equipment be used for collecting and counting votes if the equipment

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: can do so according to a procedure that does the things set out in subsection (1) (a) to (c), and
maintains a back-up copy of all ballots and declarations submitted.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the secrtaire trsorier directs the use of electronic equipment under subsection (2), the secrtaire trsorier must certify the final vote count generated by the equipment if the secrtaire trsorier is satisfied that the equipment accurately counted the votes submitted in accordance with the instructions.
A candidate for office or a representative of that candidate is entitled to be present when the votes are counted under this section.
On election day, the secrtaire trsorier must declare elected the candidate or candidates who receive the greatest number of votes, up to the number of regional trustees to be elected in each ward.
If not all candidates who are to be elected in a ward can be determined because of an equality of votes, the secrtaire trsorier must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: write on identical cards the name of each candidate whose election cannot be determined because of an equality of votes,
place all the cards into a ballot box,
draw from the ballot box by chance the number of cards necessary to make up the required number of regional trustees from that ward, and
declare elected the candidate or candidates named on the card or cards drawn.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Promptly after determining which of the candidates have been elected as regional trustees for a ward, the secrtaire trsorier must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: notify the minister, the president and each candidate of the outcome of the election, and
provide to the newly elected regional trustees notice in writing of their election.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Within 10 days after a vacancy occurs for which a by-election is to be held under section 166.2 of the Act, the secrtaire trsorier of the francophone education authority must provide notice of a by-election and of the election day for the by-election to the members of the authority resident in the ward in which the vacancy has occurred.
The notice referred to in subsection (1) must be provided by publication in a newspaper.

In the notice provided under subsection (1), the secrtaire trsorier of the authority must request members who are prepared to stand for election as regional trustee for the ward to declare their intention to do so.

A member who is prepared to stand for election as regional trustee for the ward must, no later than 30 days after notice was sent under subsection (1), provide to the secrtaire trsorier the information or material required under section 7 (1).

The secrtaire trsorier of the authority, no later than 60 days after providing notice of the by-election under subsection (1), must provide to each member who is entitled to vote in the ward for which the election is to be held the voting material referred to in section 10 (1) in electronic or other form.
The voting procedures set out in Division 2 apply to a by-election conducted under this section except to the extent that those procedures have been modified under subsections (1) to (4).
On election day for the by-election, the secrtaire trsorier must declare the results of the election.

As soon as practicable after a vacancy occurs for which a by-election is to be held under section 166.2 of the Act, the secrtaire trsorier of the francophone education authority must provide notification of the by-election to the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the minister;
the BC chief electoral officer.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 82/2022, s. 1.]

An application to challenge the right of an elected regional trustee to take office or the validity of a regional trustee election may be made to the Supreme Court by at least 4 members of a francophone education authority who were eligible to vote in the ward for which the election was held.
The time limit for making an application under subsection (1) is 30 days after the declaration of the results of the election.
Division 16 [Declaration of Invalid Election] of Part 3 [Electors and Elections] of the Local Government Act, other than section 153 (2) to (4), applies to an application under subsection (1).

For the purposes of subsection (3), a reference to a municipality or regional district in Division 16 of Part 3 of the Local Government Act is to be read as a reference to a francophone education authority.
The secrtaire trsorier must retain voting records and other documents of an election for regional trustees until 5 years after the date of the election to which the documents relate.
Subsection (1) applies to voting records and other documents retained in respect of the 2014 general local election and all subsequent elections.

If an application is made under section 18 of this regulation or section 166.18 (4) [general election of regional trustees] of the Act, the secrtaire trsorier must retain the documents referred to in subsection (1) until that application, including all appeals from it, is concluded.

The secrtaire trsorier is not in contravention of subsection (1) if, under section 76 [additional specific powers to require information] of the Local Elections Campaign Financing Act, the francophone education authority is required to provide the documents to the BC chief electoral officer.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Local Elections Campaign Financing Act applies
bcl:section.bcl:text: Subject to this Division, the Local Elections Campaign Financing Act applies in relation to the election of an individual to the office of regional trustee of a francophone education authority.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Adapting provisions of Local Elections Campaign Financing Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 19.1, references in the Local Elections Campaign Financing Act are to be read in accordance with the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a reference to a designated local authority officer is to be read as a reference to the secrtaire trsorier of the applicable francophone education authority;
a reference to a jurisdiction is to be read as a reference to a francophone education authority;
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 82/2022, s. 2.]
a reference to an election area is to be read as a reference to a ward;
a reference to a local authority is to be read as a reference to a board of regional trustees;
a reference to a local election officer is to be read as a reference to the secrtaire trsorier of the applicable francophone education authority;
a reference to general voting day is to be read as a reference to election day.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 82/2022, s. 2.]
Subsection (1) (c.1) applies in relation to an election for regional trustee for a francophone education authority that is part of the 2018 general local election and all subsequent elections.
For the purposes of section 19.1, a member is considered to be declared to be a candidate if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the member's name appears in a list referred to in section 7 (6), or
the member complies with section 16 (3).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of applying the definition of "declared" in section 1 of the Schedule to the Local Elections Campaign Financing Act, declared, in relation to a candidate, means declared as a candidate under subsection (1) of this section.

For the purposes of applying section 17 (5) [each candidate must have a financial agent] of the Local Elections Campaign Financing Act, if the statement referred to in section 7 (1) (b) (ii) of this regulation identifies an appointed financial agent for a member, the member must deliver the information and material required under section 17 (5) of the Local Elections Campaign Financing Act to the secrtaire trsorier

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: at least 75 days before election day, or
no later than 30 days after notice is sent under section 16 (1) of this regulation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of applying section 62 (1) (a) [other information to be publicly available] of the Local Elections Campaign Financing Act, a reference to nomination documents is to be read as a reference to the information and material delivered under subsection (1) of this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Initial provision of information between Elections BC and secrtaire trsorier
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of applying section 92 (1) [provision of information between Elections BC and local authorities] of the Local Elections Campaign Financing Act, the secrtaire trsorier must provide to the BC chief electoral officer the information and material referred to in that section as soon as practicable after

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a member is declared to be a candidate, and
that information and material is provided to the secrtaire trsorier.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Division 18 [Election Offences] of Part 3 of the Local Government Act applies in relation to the election of an individual to the office of regional trustee of a francophone education authority.

If a person elected as a regional trustee is disqualified from holding office under Division 18 of Part 3 of the Local Government Act, the office to which the person was elected is deemed to be vacant.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Local Elections Campaign Financing Act offences
bcl:section.bcl:text: For certainty, Division 2 [Offences] of Part 7 of the Local Elections Campaign Financing Act applies in relation to the application of that Division to the election of regional trustees of a francophone education authority.
The signed statement set out in Schedule A is prescribed for the purposes of sections 166.13 (1) and 166.24 (4) of the Act.
The declaration set out in Schedule B is prescribed for the purposes of section 166.14 (5) of the Act.
The oath of office set out in Schedule C is prescribed for the purposes of section 166.19 of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The regulations and orders set out in Schedule D apply for the purposes of Part 8.1 of the Act.

If a regulation or order that applies for the purposes of Part 8.1 of the Act refers to a word or phrase that is defined in the regulation or order but is not listed in Column A of section 166.11 (1) of the Act, a reference in that definition to a word or phrase listed in Column A of section 166.11 (1) of the Act is to be read as a reference to the word or phrase listed opposite in Column B of that section.
